topic: The council should approve the construction of the shopping centre.

data.id: Noise pollution caused by the construction and ongoing activities of the shopping center would negatively impact the residents' quality of life.
Access to the shopping center's amenities would enhance the quality of life for residents in the area.
The council should approve the construction of the shopping centre.
The influx of customers drawn to the area would provide a substantial boost to the local economy.
This is not necessarily the case, the shopping centre may adversely affect local businesses by diverting customers and may not guarantee significant employment for local residents.
The shopping centre would increase traffic in the area.
Traffic congestion would negatively affect the area.
The council could improve the surrounding infrastructure to accommodate the increased traffic.
The cost of improving the infrastructure is too high.
Although expensive, the infrastructure upgrade is worth the cost, and would improve the quality of life of the residents.
